verses.verse: אָ֚נָה <S%H575><s%> 'A-nah Where הָלַ֣ךְ <S%H1980><s%> ha-Lach gone דּוֹדֵ֔ךְ <S%H1730><s%> do-Dech, Whither is thy beloved הַיָּפָ֖ה <S%H3303><s%> hai-ya-Fah O thou fairest בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים <S%H802><s%> ban-na-Shim; ess אָ֚נָה <S%H575><s%> 'A-nah Where פָּנָ֣ה <S%H6437><s%> pa-Nah turned aside דוֹדֵ֔ךְ <S%H1730><s%> do-Dech, has your beloved וּנְבַקְשֶׁ֖נּוּ <S%H1245><s%> u-ne-vak-Shen-nu ;that we may seek עִמָּֽךְ׃ <S%H5973><s%> 'im-Mach. with

דּוֹדִי֙ <S%H1730><s%> do-Di My beloved יָרַ֣ד <S%H3381><s%> ya-Rad is gone down לְגַנּ֔וֹ <S%H1588><s%> le-gan-No, into his garden לַעֲרוּג֖וֹת <S%H6170><s%> la-'a-ru-Got to the beds הַבֹּ֑שֶׂם <S%H1314><s%> hab-Bo-sem; of spices לִרְעוֹת֙ <S%H7462><s%> lir-'Ot to feed בַּגַּנִּ֔ים <S%H1588><s%> bag-gan-Nim, in the gardens וְלִלְקֹ֖ט <S%H3950><s%> ve-lil-Kot and to gather שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <S%H7799><s%> Shoo-shan-Nim. lilies

אֲנִ֤י <S%H589><s%> 'a-Ni I am לְדוֹדִי֙ <S%H1730><s%> le-do-Di I [am] my beloved's וְדוֹדִ֣י <S%H1730><s%> ve-do-Di and my beloved לִ֔י Li, הָרֹעֶ֖ה <S%H7462><s%> ha-ro-'Eh [is] mine he feedeth בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <S%H7799><s%> bash-sho-shan-Nim. among the lilies ס sa-Mek

יָפָ֨ה <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fah Thou [art] beautiful אַ֤תְּ <S%H859><s%> 'at you רַעְיָתִי֙ <S%H7474><s%> ra'-ya-Ti O my love כְּתִרְצָ֔ה <S%H8656><s%> ke-tir-Tzah, as Tirzah נָאוָ֖ה <S%H5000><s%> na-Vah comely כִּירוּשָׁלִָ֑ם <S%H3389><s%> ki-ru-sha-Lim; as Jerusalem אֲיֻמָּ֖ה <S%H366><s%> 'a-yum-Mah terrible כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃ <S%H1713><s%> kan-nid-ga-Lot. as [an army] with banners

הָסֵ֤בִּי <S%H5437><s%> ha-Seb-bi Turn away עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H5869><s%> 'ei-Na-yich thine eyes מִנֶּגְדִּ֔י <S%H5048><s%> min-neg-Di, for שֶׁ֥הֵ֖ם <S%H1992><s%> she-Hem from me for they הִרְהִיבֻ֑נִי <S%H7292><s%> hir-hi-Vu-ni; have overcome שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ <S%H8181><s%> sa'-reCh me thy hair כְּעֵ֣דֶר <S%H5739><s%> ke-'E-der [is] as a flock הָֽעִזִּ֔ים <S%H5795><s%> ha-'iz-Zim, of goats שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ <S%H1570><s%> sheg-gal-Shu that appear מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- from הַגִּלְעָֽד׃ <S%H1568><s%> hag-gil-'Ad. from Gilead

שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H8127><s%> shin-Na-yich Thy teeth כְּעֵ֣דֶר <S%H5739><s%> ke-'E-der [are] as a flock הָֽרְחֵלִ֔ים <S%H7353><s%> ha-re-che-Lim, of sheep שֶׁעָל֖וּ <S%H5927><s%> she-'a-Lu which go up מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- up הָרַחְצָ֑ה <S%H7367><s%> ha-rach-Tzah; from the washing שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ <S%H3605><s%> shek-kul-Lam All מַתְאִימ֔וֹת <S%H8382><s%> mat-'i-Mot, whereof every one beareth twins וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה <S%H7909><s%> ve-shak-ku-Lah and [there is] not one barren אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein one בָּהֶֽם׃ ba-Hem.

כְּפֶ֤לַח <S%H6400><s%> ke-Fe-lach As a piece הָרִמּוֹן֙ <S%H7416><s%> ha-rim-mOn of a pomegranate רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ <S%H7541><s%> rak-ka-Tech, [are] thy temples מִבַּ֖עַד <S%H1157><s%> mib-Ba-'ad within לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃ <S%H6777><s%> le-tzam-ma-Tech. thy locks

שִׁשִּׁ֥ים <S%H8346><s%> shish-Shim There are threescore הֵ֙מָּה֙ <S%H1992><s%> hem-mah There מְּלָכ֔וֹת <S%H4436><s%> me-la-Chot, queens וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים <S%H8084><s%> u-she-mo-Nim and fourscore פִּֽילַגְשִׁ֑ים <S%H6370><s%> pi-lag-Shim; concubines וַעֲלָמ֖וֹת <S%H5959><s%> va-'a-la-Mot and virgins אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein without מִסְפָּֽר׃ <S%H4557><s%> mis-Par. without number

אַחַ֥ת <S%H259><s%> 'a-Chat is [but] one הִיא֙ <S%H1931><s%> hi he יוֹנָתִ֣י <S%H3123><s%> yo-na-Ti My dove תַמָּתִ֔י <S%H8535><s%> tam-ma-Ti, my undefiled אַחַ֥ת <S%H259><s%> 'a-Chat she [is] the [only] one הִיא֙ <S%H1931><s%> hi is her לְאִמָּ֔הּ <S%H517><s%> le-'im-Mah, of her mother בָּרָ֥ה <S%H1249><s%> ba-Rah she [is] the choice הִ֖יא <S%H1931><s%> hi who לְיֽוֹלַדְתָּ֑הּ <S%H3205><s%> le-yo-lad-Tah; [one] of her that bare רָא֤וּהָ <S%H7200><s%> ra-'U-ha saw בָנוֹת֙ <S%H1323><s%> va-nOt her The daughters וַֽיְאַשְּׁר֔וּהָ <S%H833><s%> vay-'ash-she-Ru-ha, her and blessed מְלָכ֥וֹת <S%H4436><s%> me-la-Chot her [yea] the queens וּפִֽילַגְשִׁ֖ים <S%H6370><s%> u-fi-lag-Shim and the concubines וַֽיְהַלְלֽוּהָ׃ <S%H1984><s%> Vay-hal-Lu-ha. and they praised ס sa-Mek

מִי־ <S%H4310><s%> mi- Who זֹ֥את <S%H2063><s%> zot that הַנִּשְׁקָפָ֖ה <S%H8259><s%> han-nish-ka-Fah Who [is] she [that] looketh forth כְּמוֹ־ <S%H3644><s%> ke-mov- like שָׁ֑חַר <S%H7837><s%> Sha-char; as the morning יָפָ֣ה <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fah fair כַלְּבָנָ֗ה <S%H3842><s%> chal-le-va-Nah, as the moon בָּרָה֙ <S%H1249><s%> ba-Rah clear כַּֽחַמָּ֔ה <S%H2535><s%> ka-cham-Mah, as the sun אֲיֻמָּ֖ה <S%H366><s%> 'a-yum-Mah [and] terrible כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃ <S%H1713><s%> kan-nid-ga-Lot. as [an army] with banners ס sa-Mek

אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- into גִּנַּ֤ת <S%H1594><s%> gin-Nat into the garden אֱגוֹז֙ <S%H93><s%> 'e-goyZ of nuts יָרַ֔דְתִּי <S%H3381><s%> ya-Rad-ti, I went down לִרְא֖וֹת <S%H7200><s%> lir-'ot to see בְּאִבֵּ֣י <S%H3><s%> be-'ib-Bei the fruits הַנָּ֑חַל <S%H5158><s%> han-Na-chal; of the valley לִרְאוֹת֙ <S%H7200><s%> lir-'Ot [and] to see הֲפָֽרְחָ֣ה <S%H6524><s%> ha-fa-re-Chah flourished הַגֶּ֔פֶן <S%H1612><s%> hag-Ge-fen, whether the vine הֵנֵ֖צוּ <S%H5132><s%> he-Ne-tzu budded הָרִמֹּנִֽים׃ <S%H7416><s%> ha-rim-mo-Nim. [and] the pomegranates

לֹ֣א <S%H3808><s%> lo not יָדַ֔עְתִּי <S%H3045><s%> ya-Da'-ti, Or ever I was aware נַפְשִׁ֣י <S%H5315><s%> naf-Shi my soul שָׂמַ֔תְנִי <S%H7760><s%> sa-Mat-ni, made מַרְכְּב֖וֹת <S%H4818><s%> mar-ke-Vot me [like] the chariots עַמִּי־ <S%H5971><s%> 'am-mi- people נָדִֽיב׃ <S%H5081><s%> na-Div. of my noble

שׁ֤וּבִי <S%H7725><s%> Shu-vi Return שׁ֙וּבִי֙ <S%H7725><s%> shu-vi return הַשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית <S%H7759><s%> hash-Shu-lam-Mit, O Shulamite שׁ֥וּבִי <S%H7725><s%> Shu-vi return שׁ֖וּבִי <S%H7725><s%> Shu-vi return וְנֶחֱזֶה־ <S%H2372><s%> ve-ne-che-zeh- that we may look בָּ֑ךְ Bach; מַֽה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- Why תֶּחֱזוּ֙ <S%H2372><s%> te-che-Zu upon thee What will ye see בַּשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית <S%H7759><s%> bash-Shu-lam-Mit, the Shulammite כִּמְחֹלַ֖ת <S%H4246><s%> kim-cho-Lat the dance הַֽמַּחֲנָֽיִם׃ <S%H4264><s%> Ham-ma-cha-Na-yim. of two armies
